intro: Leptinella leptoloba, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from March to May. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Leptinella leptoloba thrives in rocky soils and is often found in mountainous environments where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
